long: Meaning: to "denude" (especially in a disgraceful sense); by implication, to "exile" (captives being usually stripped); figuratively, to "reveal".  Usage:   advertise, appear, bewray, bring, (carry, lead, go) captive (into captivity), depart, disclose, discover, exile, be gone, open, × plainly, publish, remove, reveal, × shamelessly, shew, × surely, tell, uncover.  Source: a primitive root;
